alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:57PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Big Horn and north central Sheridan Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 555 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Ranchester, or 18 miles northwest of Sheridan, moving east at 10 mph. The storm is east of Interstate 90. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Expect ponding of water on roads and in low lying areas. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Big Horn and north central Sheridan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
